## Defines

### llvm&#95;unreachable {#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>#define llvm&#95;unreachable&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8cb1f2bd469f8a823857a1cf1447a0e3">::llvm::llvm&#95;unreachable&#95;internal</a>(msg, &#95;&#95;FILE&#95;&#95;, &#95;&#95;LINE&#95;&#95;)</>}>
Marks that the current location is not supposed to be reachable.

In !NDEBUG builds, prints the message and location info to stderr. In NDEBUG builds, if the platform does not support a builtin unreachable then we call an internal LLVM runtime function. Otherwise the behavior is controlled by the CMake flag -DLLVM&#95;UNREACHABLE&#95;OPTIMIZE
<ul>
<li>When &quot;ON&quot; (default) <a href="#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94">llvm&#95;unreachable()</a> becomes an optimizer hint that the current location is not supposed to be reachable: the hint turns such code path into undefined behavior. On compilers that don&#39;t support such hints, prints a reduced message instead and aborts the program.</li>
<li>When &quot;OFF&quot;, a builtin&#95;trap is emitted instead of an Use this instead of assert(0). It conveys intent more clearly, suppresses diagnostics for unreachable code paths, and allows compilers to omit unnecessary code.</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="#l00143">143</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/errorhandling-h">ErrorHandling.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// called.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// It is dangerous to naively use an error handler which throws an exception.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Even though some applications desire to gracefully recover from arbitrary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// faults, blindly throwing exceptions through unfamiliar code isn&#39;t a way to</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Reports a serious error, calling any installed error handler. These</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// functions are intended to be used for error conditions which are outside</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the control of the compiler (I/O errors, invalid user input, etc.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If no error handler is installed the default is to print the message to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// standard error, followed by a newline.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// After the error handler is called this function will call abort(), it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// does not return.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// NOTE: The std::string variant was removed to avoid a &lt;string&gt; dependency.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Installs a new bad alloc error handler that should be used whenever a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// bad alloc error, e.g. failing malloc/calloc, is encountered by LLVM.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The user can install a bad alloc handler, in order to define the behavior</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in case of failing allocations, e.g. throwing an exception. Note that this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// handler must not trigger any additional allocations itself.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If no error handler is installed the default is to print the error message</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to stderr, and call exit(1).  If an error handler is installed then it is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the handler&#39;s responsibility to log the message, it will no longer be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// printed to stderr.  If the error handler returns, then exit(1) will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// called.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// handler.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Reports a bad alloc error, calling any user defined bad alloc</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// error handler. In contrast to the generic &#39;report&#95;fatal&#95;error&#39;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// functions, this function might not terminate, e.g. the user</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// defined error handler throws an exception, but it won&#39;t return.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note: When throwing an exception in the bad alloc handler, make sure that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the following unwind succeeds, e.g. do not trigger additional allocations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// in the unwind chain.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If no error handler is installed (default), throws a bad&#95;alloc exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// if LLVM is compiled with exception support. Otherwise prints the error</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to standard error and calls abort().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#91;&#91;noreturn&#93;&#93; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#afcd76d92f6ad67759238ccef6ec883af">report&#95;bad&#95;alloc&#95;error</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Reason,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                         </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> GenCrashDiag = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This function calls abort(), and prints the optional message to stderr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Use the llvm&#95;unreachable macro (that adds location info), instead of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// calling this function directly.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#91;&#91;noreturn&#93;&#93; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8cb1f2bd469f8a823857a1cf1447a0e3">llvm&#95;unreachable&#95;internal</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;msg = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/regionprinter-cpp/#a79dce2d3eafaf25bf0df59f56caf9712">file</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">                          </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> line = 0);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Marks that the current location is not supposed to be reachable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In !NDEBUG builds, prints the message and location info to stderr.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In NDEBUG builds, if the platform does not support a builtin unreachable</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// then we call an internal LLVM runtime function. Otherwise the behavior is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// controlled by the CMake flag</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   -DLLVM&#95;UNREACHABLE&#95;OPTIMIZE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#42; When &quot;ON&quot; (default) llvm&#95;unreachable() becomes an optimizer hint</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   that the current location is not supposed to be reachable: the hint</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   turns such code path into undefined behavior.  On compilers that don&#39;t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   support such hints, prints a reduced message instead and aborts the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   program.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#42; When &quot;OFF&quot;, a builtin&#95;trap is emitted instead of an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    optimizer hint or printing a reduced message.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Use this instead of assert(0). It conveys intent more clearly, suppresses</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// diagnostics for unreachable code paths, and allows compilers to omit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// unnecessary code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef NDEBUG</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143" lineLink="#ace243f5c25697a1107cce46626b3dc94"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define llvm&#95;unreachable(msg) \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  ::llvm::llvm&#95;unreachable&#95;internal(msg, &#95;&#95;FILE&#95;&#95;, &#95;&#95;LINE&#95;&#95;)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#elif !defined(LLVM&#95;BUILTIN&#95;UNREACHABLE)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define llvm&#95;unreachable(msg) ::llvm::llvm&#95;unreachable&#95;internal()</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#elif LLVM&#95;UNREACHABLE&#95;OPTIMIZE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define llvm&#95;unreachable(msg) LLVM&#95;BUILTIN&#95;UNREACHABLE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#else</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define llvm&#95;unreachable(msg)                                                  \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  do &#123;                                                                         \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">    LLVM&#95;BUILTIN&#95;TRAP;                                                         \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">    LLVM&#95;BUILTIN&#95;UNREACHABLE;                                                  \\</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">  &#125; while (false)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


</DoxygenPage>
